page.title: 14The Bryanston Estate Club
page.content: The Club was begun by Lord Portman for his workers before the Great War and has been in the present buildings for 50 years; the one shilling (5p) peppercorn rent is still paid for the original building. Membership is limited to 1000 by the Parish Council. Priority is given to those who have been junior members since 13 (fee: 15p p.a.) and full club status starts at 18 (fee: Â£2 p.a. and Â£5 enrolment).There is a 10p "friendly share" to safeguard members in the event of the Club closing. The Committee of nine, Chairman, Secretary, Treasurer & six others, is elected annually. The Club is managed by a steward who has his own staff. Besides membership fees the Club is financed by sales of drink; the pool tables,juke box & fruit machines help ensure that the Club makes a profit.
